document.docAuthor: Huber, Bernhard A. & Carvalho, Leonardo S.
document.docTitle: Artema ghubrat Huber & Carvalho 2019, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Filling the gaps: descriptions of unnamed species included in the latest molecular phylogeny of Pholcidae (Araneae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Filling the gaps: descriptions of unnamed species included in the latest molecular phylogeny of Pholcidae (Araneae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Artema
sp. a:
Aharon et al. 2017
: 44
, fig. 170 ( ♀ ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material .
OMAN : ♂ holotype , ZFMK ( Ar 20593), Ad Dakhiliyah , between Tanuf and Al Hamra, Al Ghubrat Cave ( 23.0718°N , 57.3680°E ), lower entrance, in cave,
665 m a.s.l.
,
15.ii.2018
( B.A. Huber )
.

Other material examined .
OMAN : 6♂ 3♀ , ZFMK ( Ar 20594) and
1♀ in pure ethanol, ZFMK ( Om 104), same data as holotype
.
1♀ , NHMW, Al Ghubrat Cave , same entrance (“ Al Ghubrat , Quellhöhle ”),
xi.2001
( Sattmann )
.
2♂ 5♀ , ZFMK ( Ar 20595), Al Ghubrat Cave ( 23.0723°N , 57.3679°E ), upper entrance, in cave,
675 m a.s.l.
,
15.ii.2018
( B.A. Huber )
.

Note . The coordinates of Al Ghubrat Cave in
Aharon et al. (2017)
are slightly wrong ( 4.5 km NE). At that time we did not know the precise location of this cave.
Etymology . The species name is derived from the type locality; noun in apposition.

Diagnosis . Pale species without dark abdominal marks ( Figs 3–4 ), distinguished from known congeners by male chelicerae ( Figs 21–22 ; median ridges leading to distal apophyses, pair of rounded lateral projections), and by shape of epigynum ( Fig. 31 ; simple anterior plate wider than long, anterior epigynal projections barely visible). From most species also by combination of procursus distally without light notch in dorsal view ( Fig. 9 ), and genital bulb with large rounded process c ( Figs 10 , 15–16 ).

Description. Male ( holotype ). MEASUREMENTS. Total length 8.1, carapace width 3.1. Distance PME-PME 190 µm; diameter PME 160 µm; distance PME-ALE 30 µm; distance AME-AME 40 µm, diameter AME 140 µm. Leg 1: 61.4 (15.7 + 1.3 + 17.2 + 24.3 + 2.9), tibia 2: 13.5, tibia 3: 9.7, tibia 4: 12.1; tibia 1 L/d: 57.

COLOR (in ethanol). Carapace pale ochre-yellow, slightly darker pit and light brown ocular area; clypeus with indistinct light brown median band and dark brown rim; sternum ochre-yellow with light brown margins; legs ochre-yellow, patellae slightly darker, femora 1 proximally red-brown. Abdomen monochromous pale gray.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 28–32.
Artema
spp., left male palps, retrolateral views (at same scale), and epigyna, ventral views. 28, 32.
A. dhofar
sp. n.
(ZFMK, Ar 20596–97). 29, 31.
A. ghubrat
sp. n.
(ZFMK, Ar 20594). 30.
A. bahla
sp. n.
(ZFMK, Ar 20588); arrows point at distinctive deep cavities; aep, anterior epigynal projection. Scale lines: 1.0.

subSubSection.paragraph: BODY. Habitus as in Fig. 3 . Ocular area barely elevated, on posterior part with ~20 very strong hairs. Deep thoracic pit behind ocular area, without thoracic furrow in posterior part of carapace. Clypeus unmodified except for slightly thickened brown rim. Sternum wider than long (2.1/1.4), unmodified. Gonopore with four epiandrous spigots.

CHELICERAE. As in Figs 21–22 , with several sclerotized cone-shaped hairs in distinctive arrangement, with median ridges leading to distal apophyses and pair of rounded lateral projections; with very fine and barely visible stridulatory ridges.

LEGS. Without spines and curved hairs, few vertical hairs; regular mechanoreceptive sensilla either thick and variably long (~0.15–1.5) or thin and short (~0.08–0.15); retrolateral trichobothrium of tibia 1 at 9%; prolateral trichobothrium present on all tibiae; tarsus 1 with ~15–20 pseudosegments, barely visible.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 33–38.
Artema
spp., cleared female genitalia in ventral and dorsal views. 33–34.
A. bahla
sp. n.
(ZFMK, Ar 20587). 35–36.
A. ghubrat
sp. n.
(ZFMK, Ar 20594). 37–38.
A. dhofar
sp. n.
(ZFMK, Ar 20597). Scale lines: 1.0.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female . In general similar to male ( Fig. 4 ) but with distinct stridulatory ridges on chelicerae, clypeus rim not brown, and femora 1 proximally not red-brown. Tibia 1 in 8 females : 10.4–14.0 (mean 12.4). Entire epigynal area ( Fig. 31 ) strongly protruding, anterior plate on frontal side of epigynal protuberance and posterior plate on rear side; anterior plate rectangular, dark brown laterally, lighter and slightly bulging medially; posterior plate simple, very wide. Anterior epigynal projections barely visible. Internal genitalia simple, with pair of elongated pore plates in transversal position ( Figs 26 , 35–36 ).
Distribution . Known from type locality only ( Fig. 342 ).

Natural history . This species was only found in total darkness in the cave, while the cave entrance area was occupied by
Artema bahla
(and an unnamed species of the genus
Crossopriza Simon, 1893
). Within the cave, the spiders were very abundant, but often too high to reach or hidden deep in rock cavities. Their webs appeared much less conspicuous than those of epigean congeners.
